channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: New York prosecutors refute Prince Andrew's claim that he cooperated with their Epstein probe
item.description: The Duke of York, left, had launched an extraordinary public fightback after US authorities made a formal request for him to be quizzed over the Jeffrey Epstein, right with the royal, affair.

item.title: 20,000 pupils and staff in England will be given swab tests to see how Covid spreads in classroom
item.description: With approval from parents and guardians, children in England will be tested to see whether they have Covid-19 or have had an infection in the past under the surveillance programme.

item.title: Sergio Romero's wife admits daughters don't play on controversial £20,000 'theme park'
item.description: The Manchester United goalkeeper and Eliana Guercio installed the play area at their £2.8million Cheshire home last year, but did not apply for planning permission beforehand.

item.title: Daniel Radcliffe responds to JK Rowling's transphobic Twitter rant: 'Transgender women are women'
item.description: Daniel Radcliffe, 30, who starred as the titular character in the Harry Potter franchise, has called out JK Rowling in a statement released via The Trevor Project on Monday.

item.title: Boris Johnson says protesters who harm police will face 'the full force of the law' after clashes
item.description: The Prime Minister posted a video message to the nation from his Twitter account this evening following a weekend of demonstrations.

item.title: Pictured: The teenage girlfriend Maddie McCann suspect used to beat up, who could help solve mystery
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: British and German detectives want to speak to Nakscije Miftari, who was 17 when she started dating Christian Brueckner, the suspect in the case of Maddie McCann's disappearance.

item.title: Police investigating Madeleine McCann suspect Christian Brueckner hunt for his ex-girlfriend
item.description: German authorities have issued an Interpol Red Notice for the immediate apprehension of Nakscije Miftari, who has not been seen since leaving her flat last week.

item.title: How to make your own Lola's cupcakes: Bakery chain reveal the recipe
item.description: British bakery chain Lola's Cupcakes, which has been closed during the pandemic, has shared the recipe for its Red Velvet cupcakes, for those who are craving the popular sweet treat.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Government is 'set to DROP 14-day quarantine policy by end of month'
item.description: Travel company bosses in Britain say they have been assured that the quarantine plans will altered within weeks, with two legal challenges already filed against Ministers.

item.title: Elegance coach reveals how to get a man 'begging for your attention'
item.description: London-based Anna Bey, 34, who goes by the moniker 'JetSetBabe' online, divulged the top tips in her latest YouTube clip - suggesting ladies should 'play hard to get' and dress with femininity.

item.title: Oblivious Swiss tourist says he is ILL as he prepares to get on the busy Tube
item.description: A passenger arriving at Heathrow Airport from Switzerland has admitted he was unaware he was supposed to self-isolate for 14 days under the UK's new quarantine rules.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... the UK's quarantine plan
item.description: 'Penge Golf Club is too broad a location for your 14 days in quarantine'

item.title: Why dusting with a dry cloth is damaging your furniture and potentially your health
item.description: Dusting furniture with a dry cloth is a lot like washing your skin with sandpaper, cleaning experts have warned.

item.title: The grim new face of a visit to the dentist
item.description: British dental surgeries finally reopened yesterday - but we can't hope for anything like the service that we knew before the pandemic, dentists are warning.

item.title: British vicar died alone in Bucharest - leaving his Romanian husband, 27, a flat and £150,000
item.description: Phillip Clements, 81, a retired Church of England vicar from Kent met his husband Florin Marin, 27, a male model from Romania in 2015 when he was just 22.

item.title: The helpful LinkedIn tactics to get employers to come to you
item.description: An Australian careers expert has revealed how to attract employers and make job opportunities come to you by using primary and secondary keywords on your LinkedIn profile.

item.title: Philadelphia cop is CHEERED by 100 of his colleagues as he hands himself in on assault charges
item.description: Staff Inspector Joseph Bologna was charged with aggravated assault, simple assault, possession of an instrument of crime and reckless endangerment last week after hitting a protestor with a baton.

item.title: Coronavirus China: Data suggests infection started in SUMMER
item.description: A traffic surge outside Wuhan hospitals at the end of last summer - along with an increase in internet searches for coronavirus-like symptoms - suggests Covid-19 may have hit China before autumn.

item.title: Mourners pay their respects during viewing of George Floyd's open casket in Houston
item.description: The brother of George Floyd broke down in tears during the final memorial service held in Houston, Texas, as he admitted 'It just hurts a lot. Thousands visited the service to pay their respects

item.title: Part of China's Great Wall was built to control nomadic people, study says
item.description: 'Genghis Khan's Wall' that was thought to be intended to defend against large invading armies was actually built to control the movements of nomadic populations.

item.title: Expert reveals who's stretching credibility with celebrity show-off pose... and who's the top dog
item.description: Who's a bonafide yogi - and who's just posing? Here, writer and yoga teacher LIBBY GALVIN reveals who knows their asana from their eagle pose....

item.title: PE teacher Belinda Norton shares 20 things she has done to completely transform her health and mind
item.description: A PE teacher and mother-of-two from the Gold Coast has shared the 20 life lessons that she has learned that have 'changed her life and health rapidly'. Belinda Norton shared them

item.title: US researchers still testing hydroxychloroquine for covid prevention
item.description: Duke University scientists are trying to recruit up to 15,000 health care workers to test whether the controversial drug may block coronavirus infection if given before exposure, rather than afterwards.

item.title: DOMINIC SANDBROOK: Baying mobs and vandals no better than Chairman Mao's 'cultural' wreckers
item.description: DOMINIC SANDBROOK: For ten years, Chairman Mao's followers burned books, tore down statues and murdered millions loyal to the 'Four Olds' - old ideas, culture, customs and habits.

item.title: Shaun Bailey glad his Jamaican grandfather did not live to see rioters' thuggery
item.description: SHAUN BAILEY: In later years, my granddad would say he did not fight only to defeat Hitler, but in defence of the British way of life, and one of its central tenets, the right to protest.

item.title: 'Racist' sign taken down after Derbyshire race row
item.description: Over 28,000 people signed a petition demanding that a caricature of a black ban be taken down from the 18th century Greenman pub sign in Ashbourne, Derbyshire.

item.title: STEPHEN GLOVER: The BBC's comic bias is proof it has given up on impartiality
item.description: STEPHEN GLOVER: Has the BBC finally given up any pretence of impartiality, and become the official mouthpiece of the Black Lives Matter protest movement?

item.title: Scientists are testing MMR vaccines to prevent sepsis that kills many COVID-19 sufferers
item.description: Vaccines against measles and other viruses will certainly not block coronavirus, but Tulane Universityt research suggests they might stem haywire inflammation that kills many covid patients.

item.title: Tom Cruise touches down in the UK just HOURS before new quarantine measures
item.description: The actor, 57, reportedly landed at Biggin Hill airport outside of London and can now go and resume filming of the new Mission Impossible movie.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: When I saw police officers 'taking the knee' I knew it must end in tears
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: I don't blame the young officers on the front line. They were only doing what has been drummed into their heads since their first day at Hendon.

item.title: Dr MARTIN SCURR answers your health questions
item.description: DR MARTIN SCURR: Gynaecomastia is very common. It is an increase in breast tissue, most often arising from a change in the ratio of the hormones oestrogen and testosterone.

item.title: Jonathan Ross' daughter Honey has helped him rethink his opinion on J.K. Rowling transphobia debate
item.description: Jonathan Ross has back-tracked on his comments about J.K. Rowling, after he defended the Harry Potter novelist's remarks about transgender people.

item.title: Fitzwilliam Museum in Cambridge puts PPE in the frames of some of its most celebrated exhibits
item.description: The Fitzwilliam Museum in Cambridge has been closed to the public since March, but in order to bring in vital funds, it has re-imagined how some of its artworks might look in times of social distancing.

item.title: Author GILES ANDREAE shares his story of sadness and hope
item.description: GILES ANDREAE: Never have I lost control of myself quite so violently as when I was told that I had cancer for the second time. I was 51 but I had had cancer before, at the age of 22.

item.title: UK trial will tell us if fighting off coronavirus gives you immunity
item.description: Does having coronavirus make you immune to future infection? Experts say finding the answer to this question is one of the keys to ending the lockdown.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS:: Welcome to Monaco, where you never say who you work for...
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Inside Monaco amounts to a promotional video: you can imagine it on a loop in the hotel foyers, an endless cavalcade of air kisses and supercars.

item.title: CRAIG BROWN: Why goats aren't silly billies at all
item.description: CRAIG BROWN: Along with slugs, sharks and snakes, goats have long suffered from a poor public image. You might almost say that the goat is the Duke of York of the animal world.

item.title: Raheem Sterling demands black people in football get equal opportunities
item.description: The England and Manchester City forward has called for black people in football to be given equal opportunities and joined the calls for change in society and, in his case, the football industry.

item.title: The Beckhams have 'upset the neighbours' with plans to add 'security huts' to their Cotswolds home
item.description: The Beckhams plans to beef up the security around their Cotswolds barn conversion has reportedly left the neighbours irate.

item.title: The caring dogs who give dementia patients a new leash of life
item.description: Ken Will has a best friend who comforts him when he's sad, distracts him if he's angry and brings water when he's poorly. That best friend is Kaspa, a nine-year-old golden labrador.

item.title: JANE FRYER got behind the wheel of 007's favourite car for a test drive
item.description: JANE FRYER: While the car comes with a four-litre engine, smoke emitters, oil slick sprayers, bullet-proof windscreens and 007's preferred 'Silver Birch' paint job, it does not boast every Bond gadget.

item.title: So THAT'S why ice cream can give you a blinding headache!
item.description: PROFESSOR AMANDA ELLISON: We've all had that 'uhoh' feeling. Something doesn't feel quite right. Here's what you can do about some of the common causes of headache...

item.title: Mysterious GPS signals reveal GHOST SHIPS sailing in wide circles off the coast of San Francisco
item.description: Ghost ships appear to be sailing in large circles off the coast of San Francisco, giving off GPS signals without the boats being anywhere near the area, which could be due to spoofing devices.

item.title: Can 'fizzy' milk really keep your gut fighting fit?
item.description: The sharp tang of kefir may not be to everyone's taste, but the fermented milk drink has a growing legion of fans, as it flies off the shelves.

item.title: Talking Heads FIRST LOOK: Jodie Comer wows in new show still for remake of hit Alan Bennett series
item.description: The monologue series, starring the likes of Jodie Comer, Imelda Staunton and Martin Freeman, will debut on BBC One with a double-bill on Tuesday 23 June.

item.title: Louise Kerton's father pleads with police to investigate possible link to Madeleine McCann suspect
item.description: Phil Kerton from New Ash Green in Kent fears his daughter Louise may have been abducted by Christian Brueckner. The trainee nurse vanished while in Germany visiting her fiance's family in 2001.

item.title: New flu jab scientists suggest will offer better protection for over-65s could arrive next year
item.description: A flu jab promising better protection for the over-65s could be rolled out next year after it was signed off by European health officials. The stronger vaccine is designed to protect older people.

item.title: Jack Whitehall was 'terrified' when he thought he'd given 80-year-old father Michael coronavirus
item.description: Speaking in an interview with Radio Times on Tuesday, the comedian, 31, revealed he had visited his parents a week before he knew he had contracted COVID-19, and prior to the UK's lockdown.

item.title: Wearable robotic arm holds tools, plays badminton and even smash through walls
item.description: The waist-mounted robotic arm has three degrees of freedom, moves nine feet per second and picks up objects weighing up to 11 pounds. It can paint, play badminton and smash through walls.

item.title: Foreign aid farce: We send more money to rich countries than world's poorest nations
item.description: MPs have sounded the alarm about how Britain's foreign aid budget is increasingly going to countries such as China and India rather than the world's poorest nations.

item.title: Entire Roman city buried underground is mapped by archaeologists
item.description: Researchers from the universities of Cambridge and Ghent also discovered a unique public monument unlike anything else found from ancient Rome at the site 30 miles from the Italian capital.

item.title: Bonnie Pointer of The Pointer Sisters has died at age 69
item.description: Bonnie Pointer of The Pointer Sisters - a pop group whose hits included Fire, Slow Hand and I'm So Excited - has died at age of 69. Her sister Anita confirmed the news to TMZ.

item.title: Tom Payne finds chaos in Heathrow on first day of new quarantine rules
item.description: The chaos began shortly after landing when it quickly became clear that the majority of people on my flight were blissfully unaware of the new restrictions.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Watership Down author Richard Adams' granddaughter has written a book
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Richard Adams, who died aged 96 in 2016, would surely have saluted the inventive verve of his granddaughter, Lucy Moonen.

item.title: Matt Hancock reveals top scientists are 'doing some work' on UK's social distancing guidance
item.description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock last night revealed that the Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies is 'doing some work' on the science around the two-metre social distancing rule.

item.title: Black Lives Matter protestor says he vandalised Churchill statue
item.description: The masked young man (pictured), who is being searched for by the Metropolitan Police today, claimed that Mr Churchill only fought the Nazis to protect the empire - not for 'people of colour'.

item.title: American woman with viral 'hot tea' recipe shares her 'British tea' technique
item.description: Michelle, an American mother-of-three living in the UK, shared her recipe for 'hot tea' on TikTok in May. Now she has followed up with her way of making 'British tea.'

item.title: Kate Middleton urges people 'struggling' with addiction to seek help during video call
item.description: Kate Middleton, 38, virtually visited an addiction treatment centre in Wiltshire on Thursday. The royal spoke of her fears that more people will need treatment as lockdown eases.

item.title: Open All Hours and Gavin and Stacey: The filming locations for Britain's favourite TV shows MAPPED
item.description: It's a tour of Britain with a TV twist. UKTV has produced a fascinating map of the filming locations of some of Britain's most-loved TV shows.

item.title: Joe Biden DENIES Trump claims he wants to 'defund the police'
item.description: President Trump vowed there will not be any defunding or dismantling of police as he met with law enforcement officials at the White House and Joe Biden met with George Floyd's family in Houston.

item.title: HENRY DEEDES sees the Home Secretary lash out at the BLM protest rioters
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: Priti Patel (pictured) was not happy. No, she was not. Ragin'... Fumin'... in fact. She had come to the chamber (right) to issue a statement on Public Order.

item.title: Footage of Ely police officer surfaces, telling a driver he pulled him over 'because he was black'
item.description: Cambridgeshire Police says footage of a black driver being questioned by an officer in Ely five years ago is being 'examined'. In the video, an officer says 'The reason I've stopped you... you're a black male.'

item.title: Boris Johnson's government has the worst approval rating in the WORLD for handling of coronavirus
item.description: Britons rate the PM's oversight of a pandemic in which more than 40,000 people have died even lower than Americans rate Donald Trump, YouGov found.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 22 June 'earmarked' for pubs to reopen
item.description: Boris Johnson has earmarked June 22 as the date when pubs and restaurants across the nation could be allowed to reopen, it was claimed today.

item.title: Now Prince Andrew is fighting fire with fire... but at what price to the monarchy?
item.description: RICHARD KAY: No one has ever doubted his bravery. As a helicopter decoy pilot in the Falklands War, he put his life on the line luring Argentine missiles away from British ships.

item.title: Lack of evidence preventing Christian Brueckner from being charged with Madeleine McCann's murder
item.description: German police investigating the disappearance of Madeleine McCann have not spoken to top suspect Christian Brueckner yet, but prosecutors say there is evidence she is dead.

item.title: Vincent Van Gogh and Paul Gauguin letter about brothels emerges
item.description: The handwritten letter to fellow painter Émile Bernard takes up four pages and is expected to sell, by the French auction house Drouot Estimations, for 180,000 to 250,000 euros next week in Paris.

item.title: Wealthy residents complain about $10m 'Sway LA' mansion where social media stars party all night
item.description: The group, Sway LA, known as the 'One Direction of TikTok' moved into the 7,800-square-foot mansion in January, and have been wreaking havoc on their Los Angeles neighborhood.

item.title: Pregnant woman and passenger die when car crashes into ditch
item.description: A pregnant woman in her 20s and a passenger in her 50s died after their car veered off Puddock Road, near Ramsey, in Cambridgeshire in a single-vehicle collision.

item.title: Probe launched after black man dies in police custody in Devon
item.description: Simeon Francis, 35, (pictured) was found unresponsive in his cell at Torquay Police Station on Wednesday, May 20,

item.title: Home Secretary Priti Patel calls violence at UK Black Lives Matter protests 'utterly disgraceful'
item.description: Protesters ripped down the sculpture of 17th century politician Edward Colston and dumped it in the harbour yesterday as thousands across Britain demonstrated the death of George Floyd in America.

item.title: Playboy model risks arrest by breaking Dubai lockdown rules for photoshoot
item.description: Dora Rodriguez has spent most of the past two months in lockdown in a hotel room, having moved to Dubai shortly before the coronavirus pandemic hit.

item.title: China's top coronavirus expert says first COVID-19 vaccine could be ready for use in autumn
item.description: Dr Zhong Nanshan, who was appointed to lead the country's fight against COVID-19, said that the coronavirus pandemic should be tackled with mass vaccination, not herd immunity.
item.media:credit: China News Service via Getty Ima

item.title: Girls pick up McDonald's drive-thru order in 'Little Tikes' plastic cars
item.description: Taz Martin, 42, from Wisbech, Cambridgeshire, revealed how her eldest daughter Dannielle, 13, had begged her mother for a McDonald's who refused due to the long queues.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Spike feared after Black Lives Matter protests
item.description: Professor Keith Neal, of Nottingham University, told MailOnline the protests - prompted by the murder of George Floyd by police in Minneapolis - are 'not going to help keep transmission down'.

item.title: Priti Patel insists 'it's not MY plan' after Ryanair boss vows to 'block travel quarantine'
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel has today insisted that the plans to quarantine overseas passengers for 14 days amid the pandemic is 'not my plan' but 'a government plan'.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton slams politicians for criticising how Edward Colston's monument was torn down
item.description: The act of tearing down Colston's statue saw Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer and Priti Patel condemn those involved, branding the actions as 'completely wrong' and 'utterly disgraceful'.

item.title: GMB's Alex Beresford reveals he has SPLIT from wife Natalia
item.description: GMB weatherman Alex Beresford has revealed he has split from his wife Natalia after 'desperately trying to make things work.'

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: President Trump, take the knee live on TV
item.description: The cold hard truth is that Kaepernick's been shown by George Floyd's murder to be on the right side of history, and Trump's increasingly showing himself to be on the wrong side.

item.title: Spain's former king, Juan Carlos investigated over 'millions of pounds from Saudi Arabia'
item.description: The Supreme Court is looking into allegations the former Spanish king Juan Carlos (pictured) was paid to facilitate the construction by a Spanish consortium of a bullet train in Saudi Arabia.

item.title: Boris Johnson is considering slashing prices of new EVs by £6,000
item.description: It could mean that the price of the British-build Nissan Leaf EV falls from £26,845 to just £20,845 and would see a new VW ID.3 zero-emission hatchback cost around the same as a petrol Golf.

item.title: Beer gardens may open this month: Boris Johnson wants to fast-track pubs' return
item.description: Boris Johnson wants to fast-track the reopening of outdoor hospitality within weeks after being warned that 3.5 million jobs could be lost this summer if the sector remains locked down.

item.title: Mum shares how she transformed the space under the stairs into a cubby for her daughter's birthday
item.description: An Australian mum has shared how she and her husband transformed the space under the stairs to make an adorable cubby house for their three-year-old daughter.
